meanings.sent1: The child's undernourishment was evident from his pale skin and lack of energy.
meanings.sent2: Many people in the village suffer from undernourishment due to poverty.
meanings.sent3: The undernourishment of the plants was so severe that even the weeds looked healthier.
meanings.sent4: In a garden of plenty, the undernourishment of one flower stood out like a wilted dream.
meanings.sent5: Undernourishment in young animals can have long-lasting effects on their growth and development.

meanings.definition: The condition of not getting enough food or nutrients.
meanings.sent1: Her constant fatigue was a clear sign of undernourishment.
meanings.sent2: Undernourishment can lead to various health problems if not addressed.
meanings.sent3: The undernourishment of the fridge made it look like a barren wasteland.
meanings.sent4: The undernourishment of creativity in the team stifled their ability to innovate.
meanings.sent5: The undernourishment of the mind through lack of learning opportunities can hinder personal growth.
